intro: Calochortus lanternus, commonly known as the lantern cupcup, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It produces a basal rosette of leaves and has a short, flowering stalk that emerges from the center. Calochortus lanternus is a perennial plant that blooms in late spring to early summer.
